explanation: MAN covers a city or metropolitan area. Larger than LAN, smaller than WAN.
PAN connects devices in personal space - Bluetooth, USB. Range few meters.
Wi-Fi is wireless networking technology. Enables devices to connect without cables.
Bluetooth is short-range (typically 10m) wireless - devices, headphones, keyboards.

answers: Connect networks and route data packets
explanation: Router connects different networks (e.g., home to internet) and routes data.
Switch connects devices in same network. Hub does similar but switch is smarter.
IP (Internet Protocol) address uniquely identifies device on network. IPv4 or IPv6.
DNS translates domain names (google.com) to IP addresses. Humans use names; computers use IP.

answers: Data transfer rate - capacity of connection
explanation: Bandwidth is maximum data transfer rate - measured in Mbps, Gbps.
Latency is delay - time for data to travel from source to destination.

answers: Receiving data from remote to local
explanation: Download: transferring data from server/remote to your device.

answers: Sending data from local to remote
explanation: Upload: transferring data from your device to server/remote.
Bandwidth measured in bits per second - Mbps (megabits), Gbps (gigabits).
Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax) offers faster speeds, better performance in congested areas.
Ethernet is wired networking - cables connecting devices. Fast and reliable.
FTP transfers files between computers over network. Used for website upload.
HTML structures web pages. Defines headings, paragraphs, links. Basis of web.

answers: Temporary copies of web pages for faster loading
explanation: Cache stores copies of visited pages - faster reload. Can be cleared.

answers: Small data file stored by website
explanation: Cookies store user preferences, login state. Can be first-party or third-party.

answers: Does not save browsing history locally
explanation: Private mode does not save history, cookies locally. Does not make you anonymous to websites.
HTTPS uses SSL/TLS to encrypt data between browser and server.
Phishing uses fake emails/websites to steal credentials. Check URL, sender.
Spear phishing targets specific people - personalized, more convincing.
Ransomware demands cryptocurrency for anonymity. Hard to trace.

prompt: Cyber crime in India is addressed by?
explanation: Information Technology Act 2000 addresses cyber crimes - hacking, data theft, etc.
